termsPage.title: AI Picture Book Maker Terms of Use

sections.heading: Article 1 (Purpose and Scope)
sections.content:
These Terms of Use (hereinafter referred to as "Terms") apply to all users of the web application "AI Picture Book Maker" (hereinafter referred to as "Service") operated by our company (hereinafter referred to as "Company"). By using the Service, you agree to these Terms.

1. These Terms are intended to define the rights and obligations between the Company and the users regarding the conditions for providing and using the Service.
2. Any guidelines, policies, or notices provided separately (hereinafter referred to as "Supplementary Provisions") shall form a part of these Terms, and in the event of a conflict, the Supplementary Provisions shall prevail.
3. If you do not agree to these Terms, you may not use the Service.

sections.heading: Article 2 (Definitions)
sections.content:
For the purposes of these Terms, the following definitions shall apply:

1. "Service": The web application "AI Picture Book Maker" provided by the Company, which includes AI-based automatic picture book generation, a credit-based payment system, and community features.
2. "User": Any individual or legal entity who accesses or uses the Service.
3. "Logged-in User": A user who has registered an account and logged in using an email address and password or OAuth authentication in accordance with the Company’s procedures.
4. "Credits": Prepaid virtual currency used within the Service for generating pages, which users can purchase through payment methods such as Stripe.

sections.heading: Article 3 (Account Registration and Management)
sections.content:
1. Registration
   Users must register an account by providing the necessary information such as email address and password in accordance with the Company’s procedures. The Company may refuse registration if the applicant has a history of account suspension due to violations of these Terms.

2. Use by Minors
   Minors must obtain prior consent from their legal guardians before using the Service. The Company may refuse access if it cannot verify such consent.

3. Account Management
   Users are responsible for managing their login information (email and password) and are prohibited from transferring, lending, or otherwise misusing this information. The Company shall not be held liable for unauthorized use by third parties except in cases of gross negligence or intentional misconduct by the user.

4. Account Changes and Deletion
   Users may change their registration information or delete their account (withdraw) according to the Company’s procedures. The handling of remaining credits upon withdrawal is governed by Article 7.

sections.heading: Article 4 (Credits and Payment)
sections.content:
1. Credit Purchase
   Users can purchase credits by paying the specified amount using Stripe or similar payment methods through the Service’s purchase screen (e.g., 1000 credits for $10). Once the purchase is complete, the credits are immediately reflected in the user’s account.

2. Use and Consumption of Credits
   Generating a picture book page consumes 20 credits per page. Additional pages or regenerations will also consume credits. If the credit balance is insufficient, generation cannot proceed and additional purchase will be required.

3. Credit Validity and Refunds
   Unless otherwise specified by the Company, credits do not expire. Unused credits will not be refunded if the user withdraws or deletes their account (except as required by law).

4. Credit History
   Users can view their credit balance and the history of credit purchases and consumption within the Service.

sections.heading: Article 5 (Picture Book Generation Function)
sections.content:
1. Generation Process
   Based on the number of pages and the chosen theme, a large-scale language model (such as GPT) generates the title and text, and Stable AI generates the illustrations. Users can preview the results and regenerate if necessary; however, credits will be consumed each time.

2. Quality and Consistency
   The Company does not guarantee the accuracy, usefulness, or consistency of the outputs generated by the AI model. Users are responsible for re-generation or editing if the output contains errors or inappropriate expressions.

3. Saving and Editing
   Generated picture books can be saved by users. Even after saving, regeneration or editing is possible; however, additional credits may be consumed.

sections.heading: Article 6 (Community Function)
sections.content:
1. Publication Settings
   Users can choose to post their generated picture books as "Public", "Limited (accessible only via URL)", or "Private" in the community.

2. Viewing and Reactions
   Guests can view only the cover and title, while logged-in users can view all pages, comment, and use the like feature (subject to any additional conditions set by the Company).

3. Prohibited Content
   Posts that contain content violating public order and morals, infringing on the intellectual property, portrait rights, privacy, or reputation of the Company or third parties, or that include defamatory, discriminatory, violent, or obscene expressions are prohibited.

4. Handling Violations
   If a user’s post is deemed to be in violation of these Terms or applicable laws, the Company may delete the offending content or suspend the user’s account.

sections.heading: Article 7 (Handling of Account Suspension and Withdrawal)
sections.content:
1. Account Suspension
   The Company may suspend or delete an account without prior notice if it deems that the user has violated these Terms or engaged in illegal or problematic behavior.

2. Credits upon Withdrawal
   Even if a user voluntarily withdraws, any unused credits will be forfeited at the time of account deletion (except where otherwise required by law).

3. Handling of Saved Data
   Picture books or community posts saved by the user may be deleted after withdrawal. If other users have already cited or downloaded the data, complete deletion is not guaranteed.

sections.heading: Article 8 (User Responsibility and Costs)
sections.content:
1. Users shall use the Service at their own risk and expense, and shall resolve any disputes with other users or third parties at their own cost.
2. Copyright and legal responsibility for any picture books or comments created or posted by the user shall belong to the user.

Users shall not:

1. Engage in any actions that violate laws or public order and morals.
2. Infringe on the intellectual property, portrait rights, privacy, or reputation of the Company or third parties.
3. Post, register, or send any information that is false or misleading.
4. Overload the server, attempt unauthorized access, or engage in reverse engineering.
5. Send content that is discriminatory, violent, obscene, pornographic (including child pornography), or otherwise objectionable.

privacyPage.title: AI Picture Book Maker Privacy Policy

sections.heading: Article 1 (Purpose and Scope)
sections.content:
This Privacy Policy (hereinafter referred to as the "Policy") sets forth how the Company collects, uses, and protects the personal information of users (individuals or entities) of the web application "AI Picture Book Maker" (hereinafter referred to as the "Service"). Users must agree to this Policy in order to use the Service.

1. This Policy is intended to define the rights and obligations between the Company and the users regarding the personal information and related data handled in the Service.
2. Any separate guidelines, policies, or notices (collectively, "Supplementary Provisions") shall form part of this Policy, and in case of any conflict, the terms of the Supplementary Provisions shall prevail.
3. If you do not agree with this Policy, you may not use the Service.

sections.heading: Article 2 (Information Collected)
sections.content:
The Company may collect the following personal information or related data in the course of operating the Service:

1. Account registration information: email address, password, username, and any other information voluntarily provided by the user.
2. Service usage history: picture books, images, comments, likes, credit purchase/consumption history, etc.
3. Technical information: device details, browser information, IP address, and log data collected through cookies or similar technologies.
4. Contact and support information: information submitted via inquiry forms or other support channels.

sections.heading: Article 3 (Purpose of Use of Information)
sections.content:
The Company uses the collected information for the following purposes:

1. To provide and operate the Service.
2. For user authentication and account management (e.g., password resets, account settings).
3. To improve the quality of the Service, develop new features, and analyze usage.
4. To respond to user inquiries and provide support.
5. To take security measures or address actions that violate the Terms or applicable laws.
6. For marketing activities and campaign notifications (only with user consent).

sections.heading: Article 4 (Cookies and Tracking Technologies)
sections.content: The Company uses cookies and similar tracking technologies to improve user convenience and enhance the Service. Users can refuse cookies via their browser settings, but doing so may limit some functionality of the Service.

sections.heading: Article 5 (Third-Party Disclosure of Personal Information)
sections.content:
The Company will not provide personal information to third parties except in the following cases:

1. With the user’s consent.
2. When required by law.
3. When necessary to protect life, body, or property and when it is difficult to obtain the user’s consent.
4. In the event of a business transfer or merger, in which case the Company will ensure that the successor complies with this Policy.

sections.heading: Article 6 (Security Measures)
sections.content: The Company will take appropriate and necessary measures to prevent leakage, loss, or damage of personal information. The Company also ensures proper supervision of its employees who handle personal information and will promptly respond to any security incidents by investigating the scope and cause and taking measures to prevent recurrence.

sections.heading: Article 7 (User Rights)
sections.content:
1. Users have the right to request disclosure, correction, deletion, or suspension of the use of their personal information. Such requests should be made through the inquiry form within the Service or by following the Company’s designated procedures.
2. Even if a user deletes their account, the Company may retain data for a necessary period for legal compliance or dispute prevention and will appropriately dispose of the data after the retention period ends.

sections.heading: Article 8 (Changes to the Policy)
sections.content:
1. The Company may change this Policy at any time without the user’s consent. However, if the changes significantly affect user rights, the Company will notify users at least 7 days prior to the effective date through the Service or via email.
2. By continuing to use the Service after the effective date, the user is deemed to have agreed to the changes.

sections.heading: Article 9 (Contact for Privacy Inquiries)
sections.content: For any inquiries or concerns regarding this Policy or the handling of personal information, please contact us through the inquiry form designated by the Company.
